First, the first Java program's revpos function.

The revpos function in Java:

public static int[] revpos(int[] p, int[] q) {

    int[] vec = {0, 0};

    for (int i = 0; i < vec.length; i++) {

        vec[i] = p[i] - q[i];

    }

    int tmp = 0;

    tmp = vec[0];

    vec[0] = vec[1];

    vec[1] = -tmp;

    int[] newpos = {0, 0};

    for (int i = 0; i < newpos.length; i++) {

        newpos[i] = q[i] + vec[i];

    }

    return newpos;

}

void revpos(int p[2], int q[2], int result[2]) {

    int vec[2];

    vec[0] = p[0] - q[0];

    vec[1] = p[1] - q[1];

    // swap and negate

    int tmp = vec[0];

    vec[0] = vec[1];

    vec[1] = -tmp;

    // newpos is q + vec

    result[0] = q[0] + vec[0];

    result[1] = q[1] + vec[1];

}

The C program steps:

Now, coding this in C.

First, the revpos function:

void revpos(int p[2], int q[2], int result[2]) {

    int vec[2];

    vec[0] = p[0] - q[0];

    vec[1] = p[1] - q[1];

    // swap and negate

    int tmp = vec[0];

    vec[0] = vec[1];

    vec[1] = -tmp;

    // newpos is q + vec

    result[0] = q[0] + vec[0];

    result[1] = q[1] + vec[1];

}

Then, in main:

int main() {

    int a, b, c, d;

    if (scanf("%d %d %d %d", &a, &b, &c, &d) != 4) {

        // handle error, but perhaps just exit?

        return 1;

    }

    // First step:

    int position0[2] = {a, b};

    int position1[2] = {c, d};

    int position2[2], position3[2];

    revpos(position0, position1, position2);

    revpos(position1, position2, position3);

    // Second step's input is position2[0] and position2[1]

    int x = position2[0], y = position2[1];

    int sum = 0;

    for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {

        if (x >= y) {

            sum += x;

            x--;

        } else {

            sum += y;

            y--;

        }

    }

    // Third step:

    double input = (double) sum;

    long countOdd = (long)(input / 2 + 0.5);

    double result = (double) countOdd / input;

    // Print with 10 decimal places.

    printf("%.10f\n", result);

    return 0;

}
